author: sofi.heessen
title: Community Consultancy: AI & Data
description: Existe una brecha entre el estado actual de la infraestructura comunitaria y la aplicación de la IA de forma sensata dentro del catalizador

f6_assessments.q0: This is a relatively modest funding request to provide some consulting to the community on AI projects. This could be a great way to get people together within the community thinking about how we want to build AI within Cardano and make sure we are directing progress for outcomes we actually want.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is relatively simple and the proposer has the experience to deliver and has already reached out to some groups in the community who are interested thus as proposed it is likely to be delivered.
f6_assessments.q2: It is a relatively simple proposal to audit delivery of with set consulting hours and report deliveries. Success is a little harder to measure, it might be good to set some goals around the number of people/projects he aims to help.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project proposes an improvement to the Catalyst process. The aim is to incorporate AI to already existing processes (CA) and upgrading the function of proposal mentors towards consultancy in a more fixed and incentivised format. 
How the AI would come into play is to be researched as right now the project focuses on data gathering.
f6_assessments.q1: Given that there is high demand in the ecosystem to constantly improve processes, this is bound to gain some traction. The recent partnership with SingularityNet creates an opportunity to incorporate AI in these processes, potentially automating part of the current workload. Creating a place where this service would be easily contacted and reached out to would improve feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is more of a concept than an actual stepped plan. The proposer has made clear that thir will require some elaboration as the project evolves. Eventhough there is a lot written to explain what the plan is, it remains very open and somewhat vague. To improve this, there should be more concrete details on how the current processes might be improved by the use of AI and augmentation of current ecosystem roles.

f6_assessments.q0: Interesting proposal, the proposer is asking for a funding amount to help project Catalyst by advancing the current process and adding AI. This could mean a faster workflow, better development of Catalyst, overall a better structure. The proposer has no idea yet how this would come to fruition but is proposing to do the work that is asked of him.
f6_assessments.q1: Because the proposer is focusing on Catalyst this assures him of work, we are a project that is constantly in development of improving itself. Look at the challenges in this fund, we have a channel about SN and a challenge about COTI, we are constantly evolving and the need for data analysis and AI is becoming apparent. What I fail to find in the proposal is how would the proposer announce his guidance? He states that there is interest from CA Tooling and Gimbalabs but further than that we see no evidence of transparency.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this proposal is something entirely different than other proposals we don't really have a roadmap. All we have is a funding breakdown that shows us the amount of work the proposer plans on doing for the community. We get a lot of information all revolving around the proposal but nothing concrete.

f6_assessments.q0: There is some attractiveness to the idea of funding a consultant to provide general advice to the community, but my understanding is that it is not what this challenge or Catalyst more generally is about. Many of us work to put together teams, offer advice and build the community, but what we get paid for is delivering specific ideas (and defined roles like CA or vCA). Therefore, I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seems to have relevant expertise and a strong desire to do work in the Catalyst community, so if this were funded (e.g. if unlike me others think this is a good idea) there is reason to believe that it would be delivered successfully. However, it is not clear how the proposer would find the specific project(s) on which he will deliver consulting advice. Therefore, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely to be delivered successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal specifies that 96 hours of consulting advice will be delivered. This is highly measurable. However, there is no way to know in advance on what types of projects advice would be given, so further metrics are not available. It might be possible to add a metric regarding satisfaction of the users of the advice. Overall, I neither agree nor disagree that there is sufficient information to audit the progress of the proposal.

solution: Crear recursos públicos para ayudar a orientar los proyectos actuales y futuros hacia una arquitectura centrada en los datos
experience:
Bsc. A.I., experiencia profesional en consultoría de grandes proyectos de IA e infraestructura de datos
Miembro activo de Catalyst desde febrero de 2021
